intro: Lycopodium roxburghii, commonly known as the Indian clubmoss, is a member of the Lycopodiaceae family and is characterized by its spore-bearing cones and needle-like leaves. It is a perennial evergreen plant that thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant has a unique structure with a horizontal stem that produces upright, leafy shoots. Its spores are released from the cone-like structures, which are located at the tips of the branches. Lycopodium roxburghii plays an important ecological role in forest ecosystems and is also used in traditional medicine.
